# Cambridge International AS & A Level

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 277, 232, 294]]<|/det|>
## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[836, 278, 908, 293]]<|/det|>
9709/12  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 303, 310, 319]]<|/det|>
Paper 1 Pure Mathematics 1  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[784, 304, 908, 320]]<|/det|>
May/June 2020  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[760, 330, 908, 345]]<|/det|>
1 hour 50 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 357, 395, 373]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 384, 390, 400]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 418, 225, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 435, 875, 632]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.- Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 664, 217, 679]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 680, 732, 712]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 75.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 79, 99, 100]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 79, 148, 100]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 75, 593, 102]]<|/det|>
Find the coefficient of \(x^{2}\) in the expansion of \(\left(x - \frac{2}{x}\right)^{6}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 79, 920, 100]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 529, 186, 548]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 526, 670, 555]]<|/det|>
Find the coefficient of \(x^{2}\) in the expansion of \(\left(2 + 3x^{2}\right)\left(x - \frac{2}{x}\right)^{6}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 532, 920, 552]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 99, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 710, 92]]<|/det|>
Express the equation \(3 \cos \theta = 8 \tan \theta\) as a quadratic equation in \(\sin \theta\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 544, 186, 562]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[188, 544, 685, 562]]<|/det|>
Hence find the acute angle, in degrees, for which 3 cos \(\theta = 8 \tan \theta\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 543, 920, 562]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 920, 108]]<|/det|>
A weather balloon in the shape of a sphere is being inflated by a pump. The volume of the balloon is increasing at a constant rate of \(600 \mathrm{cm}^3\) per second. The balloon was empty at the start of pumping.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 120, 146, 139]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 120, 534, 139]]<|/det|>
Find the radius of the balloon after 30 seconds.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 121, 920, 139]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 72, 566, 92]]<|/det|>
The \(n\)th term of an arithmetic progression is \(\frac{1}{2} (3n - 15)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 104, 620, 123]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(n\) for which the sum of the first \(n\) terms is 84.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 104, 920, 123]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 92, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 670, 92]]<|/det|>
The equation of a curve is \(y = 2x^{2} + kx + k - 1\), where \(k\) is a constant.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 104, 146, 123]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 103, 744, 123]]<|/det|>
Given that the line \(y = 2x + 3\) is a tangent to the curve, find the value of \(k\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 103, 920, 122]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 510, 326, 529]]<|/det|>
It is now given that \(k = 2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 542, 146, 560]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 542, 920, 575]]<|/det|>
Express the equation of the curve in the form \(y = 2(x + a)^2 + b\), where \(a\) and \(b\) are constants, and hence state the coordinates of the vertex of the curve.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 559, 920, 576]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 526, 91]]<|/det|>
Find the exact perimeter of the shaded region.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 510, 186, 528]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 510, 484, 528]]<|/det|>
Find the exact area of the shaded region.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 510, 920, 528]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[351, 84, 688, 356]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 375, 920, 422]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows part of the curve \(y = \frac{6}{x}\). The points (1, 6) and (3, 2) lie on the curve. The shaded region is bounded by the curve and the lines \(y = 2\) and \(x = 1\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 435, 146, 453]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 433, 920, 453]]<|/det|>
Find the volume generated when the shaded region is rotated through \(360^{\circ}\) about the \(y\)-axis. [5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 108]]<|/det|>
The tangent to the curve at a point \(X\) is parallel to the line \(y + 2x = 0\). Show that \(X\) lies on the line \(y = 2x\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 104, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>11</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 73, 645, 92]]<|/det|>
The equation of a circle with centre \(C\) is \(x^{2} + y^{2} - 8x + 4y - 5 = 0.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 104, 146, 123]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 104, 584, 123]]<|/det|>
Find the radius of the circle and the coordinates of \(C\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 104, 920, 123]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 510, 405, 529]]<|/det|>
The point \(P\left(1,\ 2\right)\) lies on the circle.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 541, 146, 560]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 541, 710, 560]]<|/det|>
Show that the equation of the tangent to the circle at \(P\) is \(4y = 3x + 5\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 541, 920, 560]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 646, 92]]<|/det|>
The point \(Q\) also lies on the circle and \(PQ\) is parallel to the \(x\)-axis.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 106, 146, 123]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 106, 428, 123]]<|/det|>
Write down the coordinates of \(Q\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 106, 920, 123]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 312, 500, 331]]<|/det|>
The tangents to the circle at \(P\) and \(Q\) meet at \(T\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 345, 148, 363]]<|/det|>
<label>(d)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 345, 369, 363]]<|/det|>
Find the coordinates of \(T\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 345, 920, 363]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]
